storyInfo: A boy stays true to his parents' teachings even though everything has changed. After he is rescued, he decides to show his appreciation in his own unique way.

attributes.content: Grab your stuff! It's over at the slums!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: It's too late... If only we caught wind of this earlier in the day. Let's see if there's anything we can still do. Prep your medical equipment. We'll set up shop here—
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: —Not here. We still have no idea what exactly happened. Let's not draw too much attention, just to be safe.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: You're right... Bring out the medical tent. Not a lot of people go to the woods behind the hills. Set it up there. We'll head over to the slums!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Over here!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Boy. Boy! Wake up. Can you hear us?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: I don't see any Originium crystals on his body. Hard to say if he's infected or not... He's holding onto something... A staff? A kid like him?
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Nngh...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Quick, bring him with us!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We're back! Got a kid with us.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Good work. Now leave the rest to me.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: We couldn't tell whether he's infected, but he won't let go of this staff, so he probably knows some Arts. Anything else you need us to do?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: You two just get some rest. I'll give him a checkup. A few guys stayed behind at the office to listen for news. All you have to do is make sure no one finds us here.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Alright! I'll fix you guys a midnight snack to fill your stomachs. The kid doesn't look like he's had much to eat, either. I'll make some porridge.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Alright, I'll take him inside then.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: He must still be in his teens... *Sigh*... You're just a kid, but you've already had to go through all that.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: There are no obvious signs of Oripathy on the surface, but... the tests show he's infected.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: His injuries aren't too serious, but with his weak body... Let's speed things up with some Arts.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: We still have some suppressants left, and we already gave him a sedative.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: (The power generator's too loud. We're done with the checkups, so I guess we won't need this equipment for now. The lights will just make it harder to sleep.)
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: (So I'll turn them off along with the generator. The least I can do is let him get a good night's rest.)
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: (I'll also set a timer to check up on him in two hours.)
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Inside the dark tent, a tiny body is curled up on the bed.
The pain from his fever and exhaustion is canceling out the sedative effects of the medicine. He dreams a restless dream, where he is suddenly trying to find something.
Perhaps he seeks the embrace of his parents, or the warmth of his home.
But all those happy things had left him the day before. Even though he's not fully aware of it right now, his loss is no less painful in the dream.
*Cough*...!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Oh... It's dark...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: There's no one here... Mm...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *Whimpers*... It's pitch black. Is the electricity out here too?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Eep... What's that next to me? An IV drip? Was I saved after Mamá got me out?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Is there anything else here... Oh, I still have my staff with me.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Right, two men found me. They must've brought me here. I've gotta thank them.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I should get out of bed and take a look around... Phew... Ah... Just sitting up is so tiring...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *Sobs*... There's no one here... I'm all alone.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: But how come Mamá didn't say anything and just told me to run?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Will I... get to see Papá and Mamá again? *Sobs*...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: This place is so dark, and there's no one around... Did something happen to them? I... I know how to use Arts. Mamá taught me how.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: The frail boy lies on his bed and reaches a hand out to the staff by his bedside.
He was the one who put this staff together, piece by piece, from broken parts and abandoned ore, until the moment a light shone from his hands.
'Light.' He kept thinking about that word. He wanted to shine a light to help those who helped him.
The glass lampshade is still in one piece. These gears and screws are all in great shape, too, but were thrown away just because the machine broke. What a shame.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: But now I have all the parts! I just have to connect this wire to the main board, then connect it here... Maybe I should try casting some Arts?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Whoa! That gave me an electric shock! It hurts... Maybe this isn't as easy as I thought.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Papá and Mamá still aren't home yet. I can't wait to see their faces if I manage to get it fixed before they get back!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: And after I find a good job, I'll buy Mamá lots of medicine, and once she gets better, Papá won't have to work at the factory anymore.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Hmm... It takes so much force to turn these screws... Papá must be really strong. He does everything so fast.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Yeah! I'll finish this before they get home!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Mamá, look! I can use the Arts you taught me with this staff!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Hup—Look, it lit up! I built this staff all by myself, too!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I remember everything you taught me. I wrote it all down in my notes too. Increase the voltage—Hup! Look!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I'm a fast learner, right? I'll become the best Caster around. We'll have an endless supply of electricity, enough to keep the lights on all day!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Mamá, wait. They said we'll get sick if we go outside. You can't—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Papá's factory? He's not back yet. Where is he?!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I'll come with you, Mamá. Let me come. I know how to use Arts. I can—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Mamá!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: In his endless dreams, he bravely broke open the door his mother had locked, and powerfully sifted through all the shining debris at the factory. The scary disease the adults spoke of had no effect on him.

He used his mother's Arts to illuminate the sky. Under his light, the rescuers pulled unconscious workers out from the rubble one after another. His father had only minor injuries, and immediately joined the rescue team.
Then, after they got home, they moved far away, to a place without dust in the air.
He learned even more Arts, and lived a happy life with both his parents.
Eep—There we go...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Hmm—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: It's not much... Just a tiny light.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: But it's more than enough. If I can light the path beneath my feet, I can help others...!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: The ice-cold air rushes into his nostrils. The frail Perro boy has always wanted to turn his dreams into reality.
In front of the factory's rubble, he saw his mother casting Arts on such a large scale for the first time. Her radiance illuminated the night and shone upon every corner of the area.
He, too, wants to help others with his light.
Eep, it's so cold—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: What a big tent. There's no one else around, though. Where... Where did they all go?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Papá said that we should lend others a helping hand whenever we can, and only then will our lives get better...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: It's so dark though... Did something really happen here? I... I gotta go—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *Whimper*... My whole body's sore... Where is this place?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: The woods? T-The ones behind the mountains? That's so far away... Mamá told me it's dangerous here, because people rarely come.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: It's already so late, and they don't have any lights. They must need my help. I... I need to be like Mamá, and help those in need!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I need to head outside and find them...! I-I'll help them!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *Cough*... How long have I been walking...? Why isn't there anyone here?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Ugh, my head hurts.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: No, I need to hang in there. I need to be a man of my word. I need to be strong. I...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Two hours later
(It's 3:50. Let me check on him.)
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: ...! Why is the tent open?!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Where did he go?!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Oh no. I knew two hours was too long!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Quick, the boy we rescued is gone! Hurry and check the area—!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: He's not here—
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Not here either—
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Look over there! Why is it glowing there?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: —Oh, he's here! I found him!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: The next morning...
Hmm... Is it morning already?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Phew—You're finally awake.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Here, have some water.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I'll warm up some porridge for you. We made it last night. No need to chew, just swallow it. It's not going to upset your stomach.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Oh, uh, g-gracias!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: L-Last night, did I—?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: About that... I'm sorry. I shouldn't have left you alone in there.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: N-Not at all! It's my fault for trying to go outside. I thought it was too dark, so—
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Porridge's here!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: What were you two talking about? You can chat later, but you should fill yourself up first. You haven't had anything to eat the whole time, and Rita said she's gonna need to do another checkup on you afterwards.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: I'm back! Is the kid awake? Come on, let's sit you up. You must be exhausted, after running around in the dark like that. Rita, why don't you take care of your other work? The two of us can look after him.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Alright, I appreciate it.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Everything looks good. You're just a little malnourished. Your Oripathy is looking pretty mild so far too, but we'll need to take you somewhere with more professional equipment to run more thorough tests.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Don't worry, kid! We won't just abandon someone we saved partway through. Just relax and focus on getting better.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: We also have something to tell you.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Right, we're backline workers for a medical company called Rhodes Island. This is just a temporary medical tent we've set up.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We talked this over last night, but given the circumstances... Sorry, we can't ensure your safety for too long.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: D-Do you know what happened near your home?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Mamá sent me outside and told me to run as far as I could, then... she went back...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: A few days ago, Papá said he was going to the factories to look for a new job, and he hasn't been back since.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: After that... I'm not too sure what happened.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Then... Do you know that you're sick?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: I do... They told me before that you get rocks on your body when you catch this disease. A lot of people have it where I live.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Then... What about your parents? Are they both Infected?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Sí... There was an accident at the factory...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: They got people Infected, then drove them into a corner. Those pendejos!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Hey, not in front of the kid!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: My bad... I know I shouldn't get worked up, but I mean, it's just too...
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Hurry up and tell him. Just listening to this is pissing me off.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: So we were talking last night, and we're thinking about introducing you to our company. You know, see if you're interested, or if you want to go.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We have some medical equipment here, but it's leaps and bounds better on Rhodes Island. Besides, you know some electrical Arts, don't you?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We have plenty of amazing folks there who know a ton of awesome Arts. You could learn a lot from them.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Even more awesome Arts?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Yep, that's right. By the way, who taught you yours?
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: I learned them from mi mamá...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Sorry, kid, I didn't mean to swear. We're sorry about you and your parents. We'll... keep looking for them.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: Y-You don't have to apologize!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Thank you so much for saving me, and... I also want to do something to return the favor.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I-I know a little electrical Arts. I woke up in the middle of the night last night, and it was so dark. There wasn't any light at all...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: So you have no electricity here, right? Just like where I'm from? I... I was going to give you guys some electricity... to return the favor...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I saw how dark it was here. Did something happen to this place, too? But I... I passed out after a while, and when I woke up, I was back on this bed.
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: This is my staff. I was too tired last night, so it wasn't very bright, but... I can usually light up my whole house!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: So you came outside to light up our base?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Mm-hm!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: When I use the Arts mi mamá taught me, I can make my staff glow for a really long time!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Was I any help?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: (So that's why he...)
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Yes! You absolutely helped us.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: These two guys were lost last night, and you know how dark it was outside. It was thanks to your staff's light that they made it back.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: They were going to thank you, but forgot because of all the work we had this morning. Isn't that right?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: ...Yeah! Totally slipped my mind!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: We were going to sleep it rough last night, but then we saw a faint light, which led us to you. We wouldn't have found our way without it!
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: (Winks)
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: (Gets the idea)
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: That's right! Your light was real bright last night! Thanks, kid!
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: R-Really?
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Then... I'll go! I'll get even better, and I'll learn even more awesome Arts, lots of them, then I'll come back to help you guys!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Alright!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I know me being here isn't very helpful, but... I don't know where my parents are either, and I need you guys to help me find them...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: I'll come back once I get better! I'll be back to light up the whole night sky!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Alright, then we'll wait for you here. It's a promise. You gotta learn lots of useful Arts to help us out.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Okay!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: Right, what's your name anyway? We still don't know what to call you.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Just so you know, we all have codenames here, but we've all known each other for a long time, so we just call each other by our real names.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: I'm Fernando, this is Pedro, and she's Rita.
attributes.name: Office Operator A

attributes.content: But now that you're going to the landship, you should pick a codename for yourself. Pick whatever you like.
attributes.name: Office Operator B

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy

attributes.content: C-Call me Greyy!
attributes.name: Frail Perro Boy
